subject: Philosophy
title: Plato's World of Forms
description: One-minute skill: Plato's World of Forms.

hook.text: Every circle you draw is imperfect. But you still know what a perfect circle is. How?

buildup.text: Plato said perfect versions exist in a separate realm he called the World of Forms.

discovery.text: The chair you sit on is an imperfect copy. The true 'Chair' exists only as an eternal idea.

twist.text: Aristotle disagreed. Forms aren't in another realm â€” they're embedded in things themselves.

climax.text: This debate shaped Western thought for millennia. Are ideals real, or just useful fictions?

punchline.text: Plato saw shadows. He wanted the light.

quiz.question: Where did Plato believe perfect Forms exist?
